thread.title: A Superchic Apartment That’s Tougher Than It Looks

author: Heidi Mitchell
title: A Superchic Apartment That’s Tougher Than It Looks
text: I THINK WE’VE LOST our way a little as a society, building bigger and bigger homes,” said New York interior designer Gideon Mendelson, who frequently works on 10,000-square-foot houses “where it’s tough to make use of all that space for just the four residents.” When confronted with a 2,000-square-foot apartment on Manhattan’s West End Avenue (600 square feet smaller than the average newly constructed American house), he exercised his creative muscles in another way.
